Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
fix: webhook 400 error - bypass tenant middleware for Deepgram callback

**Problem:**
- Deepgram webhook was returning 400 (10 attempts failed)
- Webhook route was behind tenant/auth middlewares in tq-api.js
- Deepgram cannot send x-tenant-id header (external service)
- Tenant middleware was rejecting webhook: "No tenant identifier found"

**Root Cause:**
- Webhook registered as part of authenticated routes
- `/transcriptions/webhook/deepgram` went through tenantMiddleware
- 2133 logs dropped due to rate limit - couldn''t see the real error

**Solution:**
- Created separate webhook file: `deepgram-webhook.js`
- Registered webhook BEFORE tenant/auth middlewares (like public quotes)
- Webhook now resolves tenant by querying `public.tenants` table
- TenantId extracted from `callback_metadata` in payload
- Authentication via HMAC signature only (no JWT required)

**Implementation:**
1. New file: `src/server/api/tq/routes/deepgram-webhook.js`
2. Removed webhook from `transcription.js` (now authenticated only)
3. Registered in `tq-api.js` before authenticated routes:
   ```javascript
   app.use(API_PREFIX, publicQuoteAccessRoutes);
   app.use(API_PREFIX, deepgramWebhookRoutes); // PUBLIC
   app.use(API_PREFIX, tenantMiddleware, requireAuth, tqRoutes); // AUTHENTICATED
   ```

**Documentation:**
- Updated `docs/tq-api.md` with webhook public endpoint explanation
- Added error handling guide for webhook 400 errors
- Clarified callback_metadata location (root level, not metadata object)
- Updated security section to reflect webhook isolation

**Files Changed:**
- New: `src/server/api/tq/routes/deepgram-webhook.js`
- Modified: `src/server/api/tq/routes/transcription.js` (removed webhook)
- Modified: `src/server/tq-api.js` (webhook registration)
- Modified: `docs/tq-api.md` (documentation)

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
